required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Efficacy and Safety of LIB003 in Patient With CVD on Statins Requiring Additional LDL-C Reduction
clinical_study.official_title: Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Efficacy and Safety of LIB003 in Patients With Cardiovascular Disease on Stable Lipid-Lowering Therapy Requiring Additional LDL-C Reduction

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to assess LDL-C reductions at Week 52 with monthly (Q4W [≤31 days]) dosing of LIB003 (lerodalcibep) 300 mg administered subcutaneously (SC) compared to placebo in patients with very-high risk for CVD on a stable diet and oral LDL-C lowering drug therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, Phase 3 study of 52 weeks duration.
Patients who fulfill the inclusion and exclusion criteria will be enrolled at up to 60 sites in the United States, Canada, Europe, South Africa, Asia, Australasia, and the Middle East. Patients will be randomized in a 2:1 ratio to LIB003 or placebo. The total study duration will be up to 63 weeks which includes up to a Screening Period and 52 weeks of study drug treatment. Following randomization patients will be dosed and seen in the clinic Q4W (≤31 days).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: participants, study staff, investigator and sponsor blinded to treatment and lipid levels

primary_outcome.description: Percent change in LS mean from baseline compared to placebo in LDL-C level

primary_outcome.measure: mean LDL-C change at week 50 and 52
primary_outcome.description: Percent change in LS mean from baseline compared to placebo in LDL-C level at Weeks 50 and 52

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events as assessed by Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities as severe, moderate or mild after 52 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of Adverse Events based on MedRA based on ITT population
Percent change in LS mean from baseline compared to placebo in free PCSK9

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients achieving 2019 ESC/EAS LDL-C goals
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the effects of LIB003 on the percentage of patients achieving an LDL-C <40 mg/dL, 55 mg/dL, <70 mg/dL, and 100 mg/dL
